C1.mechanistic: The TAP kernel Sigma C(M,i)/a^i generates qualitatively distinct regime behavior depending on variant structure. Baseline admits unbounded combinatorial explosion controlled only by extinction rate mu. Two-scale introduces delayed acceleration via dual alpha parameters. Logistic caps M at carrying capacity K, producing bounded resource-constrained growth. Parameters a and mu are primary controls.
C1.functional: Variant families serve as competing hypotheses for growth-limiting mechanisms in real combinatorial innovation systems. Baseline predicts eventual explosion, two-scale predicts delayed acceleration, logistic predicts saturation. Each variant maps to a distinct class of real-world innovation environment.
C1.tier_justification: Replicated across 3 TAP variants (baseline, two-scale, logistic) with consistent regime detection

C2.mechanistic: Regime detection on M(t) and Xi(t) using adaptive thresholds. Plateau = Xi growth below noise threshold. Exponential = sustained super-threshold growth. Explosive = M exceeds blow-up proxy. Extinction = M decays to zero. classify_regime requires minimum 3 points to produce a valid classification.
C2.functional: Regime transitions mark qualitative shifts in innovation character. Plateau-to-exponential = adjacent possible self-amplifying. Exponential-to-explosive = loss of natural constraint. Corresponds to observable phenomena in technology adoption and scientific discovery waves.
C2.tier_justification: Tested across all TAP variants with consistent regime classification behavior

C3.mechanistic: Innovation-rate scaling sigma estimated via log-log OLS of dM/dt vs M per Taalbi (2025). Heaps beta from D(k) ~ k^beta OLS. Under logistic variant, sigma converges near 1 and beta < 1, consistent with resource-constrained recombinant search.
C3.functional: Sigma near 1 = innovation rate proportional to existing knowledge. Beta < 1 = later innovations increasingly reuse existing types. Signature of maturing innovation system where novelty generation slows relative to recombination.
C3.tier_justification: Single logistic configuration only; not yet replicated across variant families

C4.mechanistic: Three real-world datasets (Wikipedia, npm, species) fitted against null models and TAP variants. TAP-baseline achieves lowest RMSE-log for Wikipedia (0.036 vs exponential 0.705). Sub-exponential but super-polynomial growth matches real combinatorial accumulation.
C4.functional: Superior TAP fit validates Kauffman's hypothesis that combinatorial recombination, not simple resource competition, is the primary driver of long-run innovation trajectories.
C4.tier_justification: Three independent real-world datasets fitted with multiple competing models

C5.mechanistic: Decision bandwidth B(t) = ratio of TAP birth term to extinction loss. Praxiological Reynolds Re_prax analogized from fluid dynamics. Both derived from standard TAP quantities without additional free parameters.
C5.functional: Turbulence diagnostics connect TAP regime transitions to established explore-exploit tradeoff intuitions. Laminar-to-turbulent transition corresponds to combinatorial possibilities overwhelming structured search.
C5.tier_justification: Exploratory extension not grounded in source TAP literature; requires independent validation

C6.mechanistic: mu controls knowledge obsolescence: M(t+1) = M(t)(1-mu) + birth_term. Sweep over mu in [0.001, 0.1] shows increasing mu shifts regime from explosive to plateau, with transition timing monotonically increasing with mu.
C6.functional: mu represents real-world knowledge obsolescence rate. High mu = rapidly evolving fields where knowledge decays quickly. Low mu = cumulative knowledge domains. mu controls whether an innovation system reaches explosive potential.
C6.tier_justification: Sensitivity sweep conducted on single variant only; not yet cross-validated

C7.mechanistic: Parameter a controls combinatorial reach in TAP kernel: higher a suppresses higher-order combinations. Sweep over a in [2, 32] shows smaller a produces faster growth and earlier explosive onset.
C7.functional: a encodes structural accessibility of combinatorial space. Low a = modular digital recombination. High a = strong physical barriers. Structural accessibility, not just size of adjacent possible, determines growth character.
C7.tier_justification: Sensitivity sweep conducted on single variant only; not yet cross-validated

C8.mechanistic: N agents with local TAP dynamics and type-identity portfolios. Self-metathesis adds types when innovation rate exceeds threshold. Cross-metathesis triggers on Jaccard + goal alignment vs distinctiveness. Environmental drift adjusts a_env and K_env. Produces Heaps beta ~ 0.16, Gini ~ 0.04.
C8.functional: Metathetic extension distributes innovation across agents. Low Gini and sublinear Heaps law consistent with Taalbi predictions. Temporal orientation gate adds phase-awareness connecting innovation dynamics to organizational lifecycle theory.
C8.tier_justification: Exploratory multi-agent extension not present in source TAP literature
